name: ln8
result:
{"name": "ln8", "problem": "example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 4 * x ^ 2 - 80 * x + 1600) (Icc (10: ℝ) (13: ℝ)) := by
", "proof": ["example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 4 * x ^ 2 - 80 * x + 1600) (Icc (10: ℝ) (13: ℝ)) := by
  -- Use the definition of MonotoneOn and check the derivative's sign within the interval
  rw [MonotoneOn]
  intro x hx y hy hxy
  -- Calculate the derivative of the function
  have h1 : HasDerivAt (fun x ↦ 4 * x ^ 2 - 80 * x + 1600) (8 * x - 80) x := by
    -- Use basic derivative rules to find the derivative
    have h1 : HasDerivAt (fun x ↦ 4 * x ^ 2) (8 * x) x := by simpa using (hasDerivAt_pow 2 x).const_mul 4
    have h2 : HasDerivAt (fun x ↦ -80 * x) (-80) x := by simpa using (hasDerivAt_id x).const_mul (-80)
    have h3 : HasDerivAt (fun x ↦ 1600) 0 x := hasDerivAt_const x 1600
    simpa using h1.add (h2.add h3)
  -- Check the sign of the derivative within the interval
  have h2 : 8 * x - 80 ≥ 0 := by
    nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2]
  -- Use the mean value theorem to confirm monotonicity
  exact ge_of_tendsto (h1.tendsto_punctured_nhds (by norm_num)) (eventually_nhdsWithin_of_forall (fun y hy => by
    have h3 : 8 * y - 80 ≥ 0 := by
      nlinarith [hy.1.1, hy.1.2]
    linarith [hxy]))"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

    · exact differentiableOn_const _
  -- Use the mean value theorem to show that the function is non-decreasing on the interval [10, 16]

  -- Show that the derivative of the function is non-negative on the interval [10, 16]

  -- Use the definition of monotonicity based on the derivative

  -- Compute the derivative of the function

    have h₂ : HasDerivAt (λ x ↦ -4 * x) (-4) x := by simpa using (hasDerivAt_id x).const_mul (-4)
    have h₃ : HasDerivAt (λ x ↦ 12) 0 x := hasDerivAt_const x 12
    -- Combine the derivatives using the sum rule
    simpa using h₁.add (h₂.add h₃)
  -- Use the mean value theorem to compare the function values at x and y
  have h₁ := h x hx
  have h₂ := h y hy
  -- Apply the mean value theorem to the interval [x, y]
  have h₃ := h₁.sub h₂
  -- Use the fact that the derivative is non-negative to conclude monotonicity
  simp at h₃

{"name": "ln2820", "problem": "example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 84 * x + 882) (Icc (7: ℝ) (11: ℝ)) := by
", "proof": ["example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 84 * x + 882) (Icc (7: ℝ) (11: ℝ)) := by
  -- Use the definition of monotonicity for a function on a set
  rw [monotoneOn_iff_forall_lt]
  -- Introduce variables x and y such that x < y and both are in the interval [7, 11]
  intro x hx y hy hxy
  -- Use the fact that the derivative of the function is non-negative to show monotonicity
  have h₁ : 0 ≤ 12 * y - 84 := by
    -- Verify that 12 * y - 84 ≥ 0 for y in [7, 11]
    nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2, hy.1, hy.2]
  have h₂ : 0 ≤ 12 * x - 84 := by
    -- Verify that 12 * x - 84 ≥ 0 for x in [7, 11]
    nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2, hy.1, hy.2]
  -- Use the non-negativity of the derivative to conclude the inequality
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (y - x)]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln3010

{"name": "ln3010", "problem": "example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) (Icc (4: ℝ) (8: ℝ)) := by
", "proof": ["example: MonotoneOn (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) (Icc (4: ℝ) (8: ℝ)) := by
  -- Compute the derivative of the function
  have h : ∀ x : ℝ, x ∈ Icc (4: ℝ) (8: ℝ) → deriv (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) x ≥ 0 := by
    intro x hx
    -- The derivative is 12x - 48
    have h1 : deriv (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) x = 12 * x - 48 := by
      -- Use the power rule and linearity of the derivative
      simp [deriv_add, deriv_sub, deriv_const, deriv_mul, deriv_pow]
      ring
    rw [h1]
    -- Since x is in the interval [4, 8], 12x - 48 is non-negative
    linarith [hx.1, hx.2]
  -- Use the fact that the derivative is non-negative to conclude monotonicity
  exact fun x hx y hy hxy ↦ by
    -- Apply the mean value theorem to show the function is non-decreasing
    have h2 : deriv (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) x ≥ 0 := h x hx
    have h3 : deriv (λ x ↦ 6 * x ^ 2 - 48 * x + 768) y ≥ 0 := h y hy
    nlinarith [sub_nonneg.mpr hxy]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

      apply Differentiable.const)
    -- The derivative is non-negative on [1, 11].
